1381672439944450053.text: The Governor has an obligation to the people of Illinois to keep that pledge and veto whatever map the General Assembly sends to his desk. There’s widespread, bipartisan agreement that politicians shouldn’t be able to pick their own voters.

1381672438484844549.text: Gov. Pritzker ran on a crystal clear commitment to veto any redistricting plan that was drawn by lawmakers. That is exactly the type of redistricting process we have happening right now, and the Governor has been AWOL on this issue since the public hearings began.

1309203126205939713.text: She lives and our family lives with her pre-existing condition coverage every day. Let's stop playing politics with health care. Let's work together to make sure that all Americans have access to care and are able to get the coverage they need.

1309203124746440704.text: What's frustrating to me is that sometimes I hear my colleagues on the other side of the aisle talk about how this side of the aisle wants to get rid of pre-existing condition coverage. Every time I hear that, it hurts because I've seen what my wife went through.

1309203123739734020.text: But because of the great American medical system and the research that was done at places like the NIH for years before my wife was diagnosed, she was able to get the surgery and treatment she needed to now celebrate this anniversary.

1309203122678566916.text: It's a day that we will all remember, a day of success much different than the day of her diagnosis just a little over six months before that. We were a young couple with a 2-year-old daughter and didn't know what the future held...

1296562261092425735.text: It’s time for Democrats like Sen. Durbin to keep politics out of the post office. We need to give our letter carriers, local post masters, and other USPS employees the resources they need to do their jobs. They shouldn’t be pawns in the Democrats’ partisan games.

1296562260073222144.text: And I’d just like to note - I have been in Congress since 2013. @SenatorDurbin has been in Congress since 1983. What accomplishments from his 37 years in office can he point to that have addressed the long-term solvency problems of the @USPS?

1296562259167260674.text: Finally – I have long been an opponent of USPS privatization. I strongly believe that USPS should remain an entity of the US Government, which the Constitution empowers Congress to do.

1296562257904783363.text: I’ve also supported legislation to maintain 6-day delivery, door delivery for residences and businesses, and maintain 2012 service standards, not just in the 116th Congress, but in past Congresses as well. Learn more about those bills here: https://t.co/9R8Srh8gw6

1296562256893935619.text: I’ve co-sponsored H.R. 2382, the USPS Fairness Act, which passed the House on a bipartisan basis this past February. The bill would provide needed cash flow by repealing the mandate that USPS has to pre-fund future retirement benefits.

1296562255710916608.text: Over 3 months ago, I sent a letter to leaders of my own party urging them to include federal assistance to USPS, including the $25 billion appropriation that’s now being discussed, in additional COVID-19 relief legislation. You can find that letter here: https://t.co/oAMzcXpf1x

1296562254188511232.text: It’s ridiculous for @SenatorDurbin to suggest that my support for @USPS is recent, when he says I’m advocating for them now because I’m “getting an earful from constituents.” Yes, I am speaking out now, but I’ve been a USPS advocate for years. https://t.co/EX28wyBX6H

1222285784675422210.text: @TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 6. Ensuring state flexibility – Each state has its own unique & disparate infrastructure needs, & top-down mandates frequently fail to account for this natural disparity. States, in partnership w/ local partners, generally know best how to prioritize & address their needs.

1222284890361794561.text: @TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 5. Prioritizing core programs & functions of our existing fed surface transportation programs – fixing & improving the Nation’s core system of highways & bridges, & facilitating interstate commerce & movement of freight & people, are critical & shouldn't be jeopardized.

1222283794755063808.text: @TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 4. Addressing the infrastructure needs of America’s rural communities – 71% of U.S. public road lane-mileage is in rural America. Any increased investment in federal funding must ensure that small & rural communities are getting a fair shake & are not being left behind.

1222283361974136832.text: @TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 3. Streamlining the project delivery process to maximize available funding – time is money, and reducing red tape in the project review and delivery process will yield better results for taxpayer investments in infrastructure and save money.

1222283195514793985.text: @TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 2. Incorporating innovative developments in technology to improve our infrastructure – technological innovation has dramatic potential to increase transportation efficiency, improve safety and the environment, and create jobs. Our federal policies must better reflect this reality

1222283048894509059.text: @TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 1. Addressing the long-term sustainability of the Highway Trust Fund – continuing the status quo and relying on the fuel taxes as the primary source of funding for the Highway Trust Fund is not a long-term solution to the Trust Fund’s ongoing solvency issues.

1222282620140212224.text: As a staffer & now a Member, I’ve seen this committee work together to produce good, bipartisan federal highway bills, & I hope the tradition continues. Here are the principals @TransportGOP leader @RepSamGraves & I'd like to see in a highway bill: https://t.co/shGW8NjWbL

1217533920755036161.text: Employers should make, and have the right tools to make, conscious efforts to ensure that women have equal rights and opportunities in the workplace, regardless of their age.

1217533919693766657.text: The challenges that women face are not partisan issues, and together we can and should make every effort to address them.

1217533914761383936.text: This amendment requires DOL and the EEOC to study the impact and make recommendations for best practices to combat age discrimination of women in the workplace.

1217533913347895296.text: In fact, some research suggests that ageism at work begins at age 40 for women, five years earlier than men. This is unacceptable, and we must find ways to correct the problem.

1217533908859990016.text: @cspan According to a 2018 report from the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC), “women, especially older women, but also those at middle age, were subjected to more age discrimination than older men.”

1105841886617571328.text: By incorporating technologies & other innovations, we have the opportunity to increase safety and efficiency in our surface transporation system. I believe we can get this done & I look forward to working with my colleagues this Congress to achieve this goal.

1105841590860505089.text: As the reauthorization process moves forward, it is essential that we find ways to build more efficiently – to stretch the Federal dollar. We need to identify & attack hidden project costs by streamlining the project delivery process & reducing burdensome regulations.

1105841064462741504.text: Not only is adequate infrastructure investment important to mobility, it also creates jobs and allows our economy to prosper.

1105840859961020416.text: Our current surface transportation system has significant needs & it will only get worse as we look to plan for the future. Underinvestment has taken its toll on the system’s ability to move people and freight – we face increasing congestion, delays, & safety issues.

1105840551876853762.text: The Highway Trust Fund is not able to meet our surface transportation needs as they stand today, let alone our future needs. Congress & the Administration must come together & find a way to shore-up the HTF, providing sustainable funding for our surface transportation programs.

1105840034853412865.text: The surface transportation reauthorization bill will allow the Federal government to continue its long-standing role in infrastructure investment. But we have some big challenges and opportunities before us.

1105839001494274048.text: This being our first hearing on reauthorization, it is important to note how critical this bill is to ensuring a good quality of life for all Americans and to support the U.S. economy.

1105838580772073479.text: The FAST Act, which provided $281 billion for federal surface transportation programs, expires on September 30, 2020. @EleanorNorton @RepPeterDeFazio @RepSamGraves and I will work together to develop a long-term, bipartisan bill to reauthorize surface transporation programs.

1100873862303092746.text: This kind of coordinated system has a track record of success with other complex crime and we should be applying it to mass shootings.

1100873735937101825.text: Whether it was Parkland or most recently Aurora, when law enforcement doesn’t coordinate and laws are not enforced, people who shouldn’t have guns fall through the cracks.

1100873617091497997.text: We have many levels of law enforcement and thousands of laws across this country that work every day to prevent gun violence, but we can do better.

1100873436577103873.text: We could create another law that does nothing but infringe on law-abiding citizens’ Second Amendment right or we could create a system that could have stopped the last mass shooting and might stop the next.

1100873216178950145.text: I joined several of my colleagues in introducing the Mass Violence Prevention Act to combat mass shootings as the federal government has done with terrorism, drug trafficking, and child exploitation.
